reviewText: I've been impressed by the Little Einstein series as it brings a lot of music education into my toddler's entertainment. The Animal Expedition DVD is a favorite of my three year old boy. The characters teach a lot of musical jargon without talking down to the viewer. My son find's the stories of this video fascinating. I know he likes the music and requests the episode featuring the elephant more than any other. There is a bonus episode of The Mickey Mouse Clubhouse that makes this DVD even more of a gem. If you are on the fence, buy it!
Title: N/A

reviewText: This is a well loved and well used DVD in our home. It's fun and educational, the type of program I like the little ones to watch when some quietish time is called for. The grandkids always request this one. I recently purchased one for a gift. If my grandkids love it, and I feel it's educational, then it's a good gift too! :)
summary: A favorite with the grandbabies( age 1-6)! :)

reviewText: An incredible 4 Little Einstein show collection with fun exploration around the world.  As always the Little Einsteins inspires kids to learn and even apply things.  My favorite is to see my little one dancing and even attempting ballet moves after the episode "Little Elephant, Big Parade."  We now have 6 videos in our collection of Little Einstein movies/shows.  If we allowed her, she would watch them all day.  Great music, good stories, memorable locations, my daughter after watching at age 2 was able to remember that Egypt has camels, pyramids and where it is.  Cool, so very cool.

reviewText: My kids are Little Enstein's fans.  The older is really outside their typical audience range but she plays clarinet and enjoys the music even though she is too old for the story line.  Its one of the few things she doesn't mind watching with her much younger brother.

reviewText: Kid watched it forever over and over and I didn't mind because it is somewhat educational.No dislikes other than the songs getting annoying after listening to them over and over....then again I supposean hour of it a day is not THAT BAD. Surely there are parents who have it on some kind of repeat setting ALL DAY haha...eh... no that is not funny that is sad...But like: educational; age appropriate; diverse characters; all of the Little Einstein movies are very creative with original ideas and fun musical adventures; and of course, pat pat pat pat pat pat pat pat lolI recommend this to anyone with a child boy or girl in the recommended age range for this film.
